review_blob: Bottle. A deep chestnut colored beer with a creamy, dark beige head. The aroma is mostly on the toffee side, with caramel notes, some roasted malts and coffee. Some prunes blending in. The flavor is quite sweet, with very little bitterness. Toffee, brown gravy, some roasted hint and milk chocolate in the flavor. Medium body and a smooth carbonation. and a sweet toffee-ish finish where some dried figs show up en the very end. Too sweet and not enough stout-ish in any way. 160424

Bottle. A clear, golden beer topped by a small, white head leaving some lacing. The aroma is floral, grassy and hay-ish, with some pale malts. Its rather dry on the palate, yet with some residual grainy sweetness, pleasantly carbonated and medium bodied. Flowery, grassy hops, some hay and a decent bitterness fills out the blanks. Long grassy, floral finish with some hay notes and pale malts. A quite decent pilsener, but nothing special going on. Would like a bit crisper. 160424

Bottle. A clear looking brown beer topped by a dence, beige head. The aroma is nutty and caramel-ish, with some notes of dried fruits and brown sugar. Hints of pine cones in the far back. Its full-bodied and smooth on the palate, rather dry for the style, with a nice bitterness chiming in. Nuts, caramel, hints of coffee and dried figs in the flavor. Lasting lightly roasted finish with caramel, nuts and some coffee hints. A very decent bock indeed. 160424

Bottle. An unclear, orange colored beer topped by a small, white head soon diminishing. Some curtains. The aroma is mostly on the funky side, with leather and lemon, but theres also a generic fruityness and a touch of spent grains. Not in an unpleasant way though. Its tart and medium to full-bodied, a bit heavy on the carbonation perhaps, and with flavors of funky lemon and leather, some barnyard notes in the far back along with the pale malts, and more of a gooseberry flavor than a plum flavor. Sure a nice beer, even though theres not much trace of the plums. 160424

Can. An unclear, orange colored beer with a dense, off-white head leaving curtains. Lots of pine cones, resins and citrus zest on the nose. Orange and grapefruit. Some malt notes. Its full-bodied, perhaps a bit heavy on the carbonation, and rather dry, with lots of bitterness. Pine cones, grapefruit and orange zest, a touch of malts and malty sweetness in the far back. Everlasting bitterness and grapefruit. It feels very bitter, more than the IBU suggests, but its sure a fine one. Dry, quenching and easy drinkable. 160424

Bottle. It pours a dark chestnut to brown body under a small, beige head. The aroma has a lot of lovely coffee, with a touch of alcohol and caramel. Some roasted malts, brown sugar and dark chocolate notes. Its full-bodied, warming and quite smooth on the palate, Brown sugar, molasses, some dark chocolate and loads of delicious coffee in the flavor, along with general sweetness, alcohol and some bitterness. Everlasting coffee dominated finish where some licorice and dark chocolate chimes in. Some roasted malts. Probably a bit heavy on the booze this one, but its a damn fine beer anyway. 160423

Bottle, 75cl corked. It pours a hazy pale golden body under a big, foamy white head. Theres lots of lemony brett in the aroma, with pine cones, pineapple, some candied peach, hints of leather and barnyard and a faint grassy touch. Notes of mandarine and also a whiff of pale malts. Even some gooseberries. Its dry and rather effervescent on the palate, medium to full-bodied, almost tart. Lemon, pineapple, candied peach, some funky flavors and a really fine bitterness in the flavor. Everlasting fruity and bitter finish with funkyness and a faint peppery hint. Its perhaps a bit too enthusiastic awarding a 9 for flavor, its not at the same level as the aroma, especially not initially, but the finish is just lovely. It sure deserves a very high rating. I could easily accept this as a regular beer. 160423

Can. It pours an almost clear body, golden in color and with a small, dense, off-white head. Some curtains. The aroma has a light bready maltyness, some caramel too, and piney, resiny and grassy hops. Pale malt notes, some bread and caramel in the flavor, but its hop focused, with lots of bitterness, and compared to modern standards, even though theres hoppy flavors, theres not too much of them. Some grass too. Full body and a nice carbonation level. Mostly on the dry side. Lasting finish. A pleasant one indeed, but I sure prefer the modern style. 160423

Can. A llightly hazy orange-golden beer with a dense, finger-thick, beige head. Some lacing. The aroma is lightly sweetish-fruity, wiith lots of piney hops. Some orange zest too. Its full-bodied, sweet and lightly warming on the palate, nicely carbonated. Some malty sugary sweetness in the flavor, but mostly its citrusy, piney hops and of course a good bitterness. Its not extremely bitter in any way, but it overpowers the sweetness without any problems. Some tropical fruit notes too. Lasting, rather bitter finish with orange zest and pine cones. Perhaps a bit on the sweet side this one, but its sure a fine brew. 160423

Bottle. A more or less clear one, brown in color and with a dense, finger-thick beige head. The aroma has caramel, roasted malts, some anise seeds, some prunes and blue plums and a sourish burnt malts touch. Its smooth and rather dry on the palate, with a decent carbonation, medium bodied. Roasted malts, some bonfire hints, dark chocolate, hints of prunes and anise seeds as well as some sourish burnt malts hints in the flavor. Decent hoppy bitterness and also some resiny hop notes. Long finish with more chocolate than initially. A decent one, but theres too many good porters on the market so I dont see myself repeating this one. 160423

Bottle. It pours a very dark brown, close to black body under a small, beige head. The aroma is roasted, with some licorice, molasses and coffee. Its full-bodied and rather dry on the palate, perhaps a bit heavy on the carbonation. Roasted malts, some caramel notes, molasses, coffee and licorice in the flavor. Some bitterness too, but its mostly on the sweet side. Long roasted finish with licorice and molasses. Not much trace of the juniper berries, but theres some on the nose. Overall, sure a decent stout. I wouldnt mind a bit more complexity, but its a fine brew anyway. Easy drinkable too. 160423

Bottle. An almost clear one, amber colored and with a small, dense, beige head. The aroma is fruity, with some caramel and berry-like hints. Its medium to full-bodied, with a soft carbonation, rather dry. Caramel, some bread and a faint berry touch. Some more berries in the finish. Not bad in any way this one, but too one dimensional for me. And perhaps the rose hips could be more present. 160423

Bottle, 75cl corked. An unclear brown beer topped by a dense, finger-thick light beige colored head. Pressure treated wood is the first thing that strikes me when putting my nose close to the glass, then some vanillin-ish notes and caramel chimes in. Its full-bodied, a bit effervescent and semi-sweet, with flavors of caramel, some dried fruits and the same pressure treated wood and vanillin found in the aroma. Appropriate bitterness. Lasting oak and vanillin finish with caramel and some prunes. An interesting beer, but I guess it wouldve been more interesting using some staves from barrels used for booze or wine. 160423
beer_name: Vestfyen Willemoes 55 Grader Nord Rd Lager

review_blob: Bottle. An unclear, orange-golden colored beer topped by a small, white head. The aroma is fruity with some sea water hints, chalk and and canned peaches. Its lightly salty on the palate, medium bodied and softly carbonated, with some bitterness chiming in. Some sweetness is present, with canned peaches, some chalk and a generic fruityness. Mostly fruity finish. Not much interesting going on here. 160423

On tap at the brewpub. Almost clear in the glass, deep chestnut colored and with some beige bubbles on top. The aroma has brown sugar, caramel and toffee in abundance, with leather, cigar notes, licorice and maple syrup. Some dark rye bread and cocoa. Its full bodied, sweet and lightly warming, with lots of dark flavors, perhaps a bit more licorice focused than the aroma. Some booze too. Lasting finish. This could easily be sold as a liqueur. Really nice. 160423

On tap at the brewpub. Its an unclear pale golden colored beer with a creamy white head. Fruity, mostly citrusy aroma, lemon and tropical fruits, some pale malts. Its medium bodied and nicely carbonated, quite dry, with a fine bitterness going well with the citrus zest and the touch of pale malts. Lasting dry and fruity finish with a fine bitterness. A straightforward and quenching beer at a low ABV. Nice. 160423

On tap at the brewpub. A creamy dark beige head sits on top of a brown body. Caramel, some chocolate, oatmeal biscuits and cloves in the aroma, with a good dash of ripe bananas. Its smooth yet sort of effervescent, its semi sweet and medium to full bodied, with banana, chocolate, toffee, biscuits and a touch of bitterness. Long finish that is a bit more on the fruity side. A decent one indeed. 160423

On tap at the brewpub. An unclear pale yellow drink with a small white head. Apple dominated aroma with something pale fruity beer-ish in the back. Some grass. Its dry and pleasantly carbonated, with fruityness. Bready hints in the back of the flavor, with apples and a generic fruityness up front. Long finish. Not my kind of drink, but its refreshing and interesting anyway. 160423

On tap at the brewpub. An unclear amber colored beer with a creamy light beige head. Toffee, more or less butterscotch, and some prunes on the nose. Generic fruityness too. Its full bodied and smooth on the palate, semi dry, with flavors of caramel, toffee, prunes and some canned peaches. Low on bitterness, both initially and in the finish. Not a favorite, but sure decent. 160423

On tap at the brewpub. Its a lightly hazy golden colored beer with a creamy finger thick head. Theres a faint touch of diacetyl in the aroma, with fruityness dominating. Pineapple, some peach and melon, hints of grass. Its very smooth on the palate, quite dry, and medium bodied. Mostly fruity flavor too, with a fine bitterness. Some pale malts in the back. Lasting dry, bitter and fruity finish. A decent and refreshing beer. 160423

Can. An unclear pale golden beer with a dense, finger-thick off-white head. The aroma has lots of berries, some lingonberry and a touch of generic fruityness. Not much maltyness going on, neither in the aroma nor in the flavor. Fruity, blueberry flavor with a little bitterness and some malty sweetness. Medium body, nice carbonation, quite dry. Blueberry finish with a generic fruityness. A quite decent one, sort of one dimensional. 160423

Can. An amber colored beer, hazy, and with a dense, finger-thick light beige head. Spiced, caramel-ish, bread-ish aroma with pine cones, resins, some orange zest and a peppery rye touch. Licorice hints. Its full-bodied, smooth and with a nice bitterness. Resins, pine cones, citrus zest, licorice hints and a touch of bread and toffee in the flavor, all lasting for a good while. A fine beer indeed, although a tad on the bready, malty side. 160422

Bottle. A lightly hazy one, golden in color and with a small, dense, off-white head on top. Some lacing. The aroma is mostly piney and resiny, with some tropical fruit and a touch of pale malts. A faint dusty hint too. Medium body and a nice carbonation, its semi dry, wtih hoppy flavors dominating. Some bready malts as a backdrop. Resins, pine cones and a touch of tropical fruits towards the finish. Sure a tasteful and pleasant one, quenching and easy drinkable. 160422

Bottle. An unclear, glowing orange colored beer with a small, dense off-white head. The aroma is fruity and funky, with gooseberries, leather, lemon and barnyard. The flavor is much more complex, with grapes, gooseberries and some canned peach and pineapple added. Its smooth yet quite carbonated, dry and tart and medium bodied. Long finish with a prickling sensation on the tongue, almost like when eating pineapple. Delicious and tasteful, pity the aroma isnt on the same level as the flavor. 160422

Bottle. A hazy dark golden beer with lots of carbonation and a minimal sized off-white head leaving some lacing. Fruity, almost candy-ish aroma with some lemon juice. Mandarine hints, something earthy and a hint of apple, pear, peach and pineapple. In a weird way it also smells salty. Theres some saltyness in the flavor though, but its more on the tart lemony side. Medium bodied and smooth, with lots of berries in the flavor. Fruit, lemon, some mandarine and a leathery hint too. Everlasting quite dry, tart and sour finish. Sure one of the best low alcohol beers Ive had in a long time. Super complex and quenching. Love it. 160422

Can. A clear, golden to amber colored beer with a dense, finger-thick off-white head. The aroma is nice, but too bready and malty in my opinion. Some spent grain notes, a grassy touch and some pine cones and resins. Its full-bodied, smooth and with a nice carbonation. Rather malt-driven flavor too, bread and grains, with a soft bitterness. Some resiny, piney and lightly citrusy hops. Long hop dominated finish with some malts in the back. A decent beer indeed, but I prefer my pale ales more hop focused. 160422

On tap at Patricks. A dark, dark brown beer with a dense, small head leaving lacing. The aroma has a good dash of dark dried fruits, some coffee grit and coffee, dark chocolate and a good dash of licorice. Almost more on the stout side Id say. Its full bodied and very smooth on the palate, softly carbonated and semi sweet. Lots of licorice in the flavor too, with roasted malts, some dark chocolate and coffee grit. A nice bitterness is lurking in the far back. Some piney hops too. Lasting roasted finish with licorice. An unusual brown ale, but nice anyway. 160415

On tap at Patricks. An almost clear one, golden in colour and with a small, dense, white head leaving curtains. Piney, citrusy and lightly flowery aroma, grapefruit standing out. Not much going on on the malty side. Its medium bodied, semi dry and super smoothly carbonated, perhaps a bit low on bitterness. At least I would like it a bit more bitter. Pine cones, grapefruit notes, generic fruityness and some flowery notes in the flavor. Lasting grapefruit finish with pine cones and bitterness. A very easy drinkable and quite tasteful beer. Gentle, borderline subtle, a beer made for the summer. Quenching. 160415

On tap at Bde&. A hazy golden colored beer with a small off-white head. The aroma is mostly fruity, some citrus juice, and not much else. A light grassy, herbal touch too. Its rather salty on the palate, with a nice carbonation. Dry and medium bodied with some grapefruity bitterness. Yes, its salty, but its not unpleasant, just unusual. Citrus, some peaches and yellow plums in the flavor, some grass kicking in towards the finish. Refreshing and tasteful, guess it needs a summer day to really shine. 160415

Bottle. An unclear orange colored beer weigh a dense finger thick white head. Fruity, quite sugary aroma with some peppery yeast and peaches. Fruity flavor too, with white sugar and some yeast and citrus. Decent bitterness. Fruity, yeasty and sugary finish with some peppery hints. Lacking a bit on complexity, but its a decent one anyway. 160409

Bottle. A brown beer, hazy looking, and with a dense light tan head on top. Theres lots of raspberry in the aroma, with toffee and some dark chocolate. Nuts and some coffee. Lots of raspberry in the flavor too, with coffee, chocolate and toffee in the back. And of course some warning alcohol. Full body and a smooth carbonation. Sort of sweetish. Hints of cherry pits in the finish. A fine brew, but I guess it would have been better without the raspberries. 160409

Bottle. A hazy, kiwi green beer with a small, dense, white head. Typical Fantome aroma, yeasty and herbal, with a lemony hint and some spiced hints. Its full to medium bodied, dry and nicely carbonated. Lightly herbal flavor, with some lemon and peppery yeast. Lasting lemony fruity finish with black pepper and a hint of yeast. Not looking good this one, funny, but not good looking. But its a very fine beer anyway. Typical Fantome.160409

Bottle. A clear, golden colored beer with a small, dense off-white head. Some lacing. Quite fruity aroma, with bready grains and some pine cones. Decent bitterness in the mouth, with fruityness and some bready notes. Piney hints too. Medium length finish, mostly on the fruity side. Rather boring, but flawless and easy drinkable. 160409

Bottle. A cloudy grey-ish yellow mead with some white bubbles. Lots of heather honey on the nose, with some lemon. Its medium bodied, sourish and with some light carbonation. Sour, lemony flavor with lots of heather honey. A rather weird one, not very good. 160409

Bottle. A dark, dark brown beer with a minimal sized light beige head. Theres lots of cocoa in the aroma, with burnt and roasted malts and some bonfire. Its smooth and medium bodied, semi sweet but without being sticky in any way. Roasted malts, burnt down bonfire and some dried fruits. Lasting roasted, bonfire-ish finish. Too much on the bonfire side this one. 160409
beer_name: Brew By Numbers 03/04 Porter Bramling Cross

review_blob: Bottle, 22oz. Its a lightly hazy golden beer with a small, dense off-white head. The aroma is hop forward indeed, peachy, resiny and with some canned tropical fruits and a bready malt scent. Its full bodied, warming and quite smooth on the palate, with a good dash of bitterness. Peaches, generic tropical fruits and some resins and pine cones. Lasting bitter, fruity finish. Overall, a bit warming, but sure pleasant. 160409

Bottle. A clear golden beer with a dense finger thick off-white head leaving some lacing. Fruity, clove like aroma with some peaches and caramel. Lightly flowered flavor with citrusy fruityness and some caramel. Decent bitterness. Some anise and lemon zest too. Lasting finish. Far from superb this one, messy but drinkable. 160409

Bottle, 22oz. A hazy golden ale with a dense two finger off-white head leaving lacing. Fruity aroma, citrus and orange peel, some banana and peaches, and a hint of peppery, chalky yeast. Its lightly warming on the palate, full bodied and lightly effervescent, semi dry. Citrus, orange zest, banana hints, pepper hints and bitterness. Lasting fruity finish with some chalky yeast hints. Quite nice, but a tad yeasty. 160409

Bottle. A hazy dark golden beer with a minimal sized head. The aroma is fruity with a light piney touch. Some light funky hints. Theres a fine bitterness in the mouth, its medium bodied and smooth, with flavors of citrus, pine cones and a light malty touch. And some sourness and funk. Medium length finish. Nothing special going on here, actually its sort of bad. 160409

Bottle, from the brewery. An almost clear one, straw colored and with a small, dense, white head. The aroma is rather grassy and hayish, with fruityness and some pale malts. Theres a light and pleasant bitterness in the mouth, with a soft carbonation. Semi dry, with flavors of grass and hay. Something peppery too. Long grassy finish with hay and fruityness. Nice and easy drinkable. 160409
UPDATED: APR 7, 2016

On tap at Bde&. Its an almost clear one, golden in colour and with a small white head. Quite grassy aroma with fruityness, some green banana and cloves, a touch of yeast and some pale malts. Its dry on the palate, medium bodied and smooth, with flavors of yeast, banana, some cloves and a little sweetness. Lasting mostly fruity finish with a nice bitterness. Refreshing indeed, but a bit too yeasty I think. 160407

On tap at Bde&. It pours a murky brown body under a dense finger thick beige head. The aroma is lightly yeasty, mostly fruity, with dried fruits like raisins and prunes. Some light roasted malts and licorice. Its full bodied, smooth and pleasantly carbonated, with a bit too much yeast flavors. Dried fruits, grass and a generic yeast flavor. Ok bitterness. Lasting finish. Guess its still a bit fresh, but its a decent beer. 160407

On tap at Kick. A dense, small, beige head forms over a brown body. Vanilla, peanuts, chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts in the aroma. Theres a salty touch in the flavor, but its mostly on the sweet side. Its full bodied, smooth and dry, with a pleasant carbonation. Roasted malts, peanuts, chocolate and some coffee in the flavor, all lasting for a good while. Pretty lovely, but I guess one glass will be enough. 160407
beer_name: Buxton / Omnipollo Chocolate Ice Cream Brown Ale

review_blob: On tap at Kick. An unclear orange-golden colored beer with a small, dense off-white head. The aroma is lightly alcoholic, with fruityness, cellar and some caramel. Its full bodied, smooth and semi dry, with flavors of peaches, pine cone notes and some caramel. Decent bitterness. Lasting fruity finish with caramel and some cellar. Sort of dusty. Not my kind of beer. 160407
beer_name: Birrificio Italiano Malt Liquor Sparrow Pit

review_blob: On tap at Kick. It pours an unclear orange golden body under a creamy off-white head. Cute lacing. The aroma is quite heavy, with pine cones, peaches, some alcohol and a pleasant malty touch. Lightly alcoholic flavor with oranges, citrus, bitterness, and some malts. Peach hints. Full body, some warmth and a nice carbonation. Lasting fruity, piney finish with malts in the back. A bit heavy on the alcohol, but a tasteful and pleasant beer anyway. 160407

On tap at Kick. Its an unclear orange colored beer with a minimal sized white head leaving lacing. Oranges, pine cones and some resins on the nose, with some hints of malts. Its medium to full bodied with a soft carbonation. Quite dry. Oranges, pine cones and resins and a fine bitterness in the mouth, lasting for a good while. Very refreshing and easy drinkable. Sure worth a revisit. 160407
beer_name: 7 Fjell / Brew By Numbers 5155 Norwegian Wilderness IPA

review_blob: Bottle, at Patricks. It produces a lot of light beige foam over a lightly hazy light brown body. Lacing. The aroma is a bit weak I think, with dark caramel, some roasted malts, a hint of ham and bonfire and some citrus hints. The flavor is likewise, weak, with a fine bitterness. Full to medium body and a bit heavy carbonation, semi dry. Long finish with more bitterness than smoke. Drinkable and flawless, but too heavy on the carbonation and lacking on smoke. In my opinion. 160407

On tap at Patricks. An almost clear one, rather pale golden in color and with a dense, finger thick white head. Lacing. Grassy, lightly fruity nose with biscuity pale malts and then even more grass. Its smooth, medium bodied and quite dry on the palate, with a fine bitterness, and flavors of grass, pale malts and a faint piney, citrusy hint. Long grassy finish with pine cones and some citrus. Far from the most exciting beer from this brewery, but its quenching and easy drinkable, could be a summer hit. 160407

Bottle. Its a candy red beer topped by a run off white bubbles leaving some curtains. The aroma is dominated by cherry and lemon juice, with some almond notes and a funky, barnyard-ish touch in the back. Its quite smooth on the palate, with a nice carbonation and medium body fullness. Dry. Some lemon sourness in the flavor, with sour cherries and a little hint of barnyard, leather and almond. Tart, cherry flavored finish with lemon juice and some almond. Overall, sure a fine brew. Tasteful, quenching and very easy drinkable. 160405
beer_name: Alvinne / Laugar Ich Bin Ein Berliner Kriek
